objects.thumbCaption:
Comet Holmes in Perseus
Comet Holmes reached naked-eye brightness in 2007 after some amazing outbursts. It is the fuzzy object just left of the bright stars of Perseus.
objects.photodata:
Title Comet Holmes in Perseus

Description Comet Holmes reached naked-eye brightness in 2007 after some amazing outbursts. It is the fuzzy object just left of the bright stars of Perseus.

Original Date 11/1/07, 8:45 AM

Make Canon

Camera Canon EOS DIGITAL REBEL XT

Focal Length (35mm) 66mm

Metering Mode Partial

ISO Equivalent 800

Exposure Time 20.0s

Aperture ƒ/11.0

Exposure bias 0 EV

Exposure Program Manual control

White balance Auto white balance

Flash Flash did not fire

Resolution 804 x 836

objects.photodata:
Title Comet Holmes

Description Comet Holmes underwent an outburst in 2012 that made it visible to the naked-eye. This image was taken with a Canon Digital Rebel XT on the 12" Meade with a focal reducer that caused star flaring/blurriness. Apparently tracking was off, hence trailing.

Original Date 11/2/07, 11:56 AM

Make Canon

Camera Canon EOS DIGITAL REBEL XT

Focal Length (35mm) 0mm

Metering Mode Partial

ISO Equivalent 800

Exposure Time 13.0s

Aperture ƒ/∞

Exposure bias 0 EV

Exposure Program Manual control

White balance Auto white balance

Flash Flash did not fire

Resolution 1248 x 832
objects.title: Comet Holmes
objects.imageCaption:
Comet Holmes
Comet Holmes underwent an outburst in 2012 that made it visible to the naked-eye. This image was taken with a Canon Digital Rebel XT on the 12" Meade with a focal reducer that caused star flaring/blurriness. Apparently tracking was off, hence trailing.
objects.name: 2007-11-02-Holmes10_W.jpg
objects.comment: Comet Holmes underwent an outburst in 2012 that made it visible to the naked-eye.  This image was taken with a Canon Digital Rebel XT on the 12" Meade with a focal reducer that caused star flaring/blurriness.  Apparently tracking was off, hence trailing.

objects.photodata:
Title Comet C/2009 P1 (Garradd)

Description Comet C/2009 P1 Garradd imaged by the Atik CCD on the 80 mm APO on 3/22/12. The colors are redder than actual colors (which are normally greenish). This comet sports a fanned out tail above the coma.

Original Date 3/22/12, 12:00 AM

Make Atik

Camera 383L

objects.photodata:
Title Comet C/2011 L4 PanSTARRS

Description Comet C/2011 L4 PanSTARRS in 3/14/13 taken with the Canon Digital Rebel with its kit lens on a tripod. This comet was barely visible to the naked eye. The comet's tail points roughly upwards and away from the Sun (which is the norm).

Original Date 3/14/13, 8:41 PM

Make Canon

Camera Canon EOS DIGITAL REBEL XT

Focal Length (35mm) 89mm

Metering Mode Multi-segment

ISO Equivalent 400

Exposure Time 30.0s

Aperture ƒ/5.6

Exposure bias 0 EV

Exposure Program Manual control

White balance Auto white balance

Flash Flash did not fire

Resolution 1248 x 832

objects.title: PanSTARRS at Sunset
objects.imageCaption:
PanSTARRS at Sunset
A movie of comet C/2011 L4 (PanSTARRS) and its visible tail as the sun sets. It moves from slightly left of middle center (hard to see at first) to slightly right of bottom center. Taken 3/14/13.
objects.name: 2013-03-14-C2011L4PanSTARRS_W.jpg
objects.comment: A movie of comet C/2011 L4 (PanSTARRS) and its visible tail as the sun sets. It moves from slightly left of middle center (hard to see at first) to slightly right of bottom center. Taken 3/14/13.

objects.thumbCaption:
PanSTARRS at Sunset 2

objects.thumbCaption:
Comet Johnson Movie
A movie of Comet C/2015 V2 (Johnson) on 6/24/17. It is the fuzzy object near the top middle, moving upward. It reached perihelion on June 12th, and is currently…
objects.title: Comet Johnson Movie
objects.imageCaption:
Comet Johnson Movie
A movie of Comet C/2015 V2 (Johnson) on 6/24/17. It is the fuzzy object near the top middle, moving upward. It reached perihelion on June 12th, and is currently about 7th magnitude.
objects.name: 2017-06-24-Johnson_W.jpg
objects.comment: A movie of Comet C/2015 V2 (Johnson) on 6/24/17. It is the fuzzy object near the top middle, moving upward. It reached perihelion on June 12th, and is currently about 7th magnitude.

objects.thumbCaption:

A short movie of Comet C/2017 O1 (ASASSN) moving through the sky, in black and white. It is the faint object, which appears to be moving quickly, but this is…
objects.title: Comet ASASSN
objects.imageCaption:
Comet ASASSN
A short movie of Comet C/2017 O1 (ASASSN) moving through the sky, in black and white. It is the faint object, which appears to be moving quickly, but this is due to the framerate of the video. Taken with Atik on 10/17/17, at about magnitude 8.5.
objects.name: 2017-10-17-C2017-O1-ASASSN.jpg
objects.comment: A short movie of Comet C/2017 O1 (ASASSN) moving through the sky, in black and white. It is the faint object, which appears to be moving quickly, but this is due to the framerate of the video. Taken with Atik on 10/17/17, at about magnitude 8.5.

Title Comet 46P Animation

Description A GIF animation of Comet 46P/Wirtanen, created from multiple exposures taken with the Canon T5i on 12/07/18. Some trailing is noticeable on some longer exposures, where the comet appears elongated.

comment: Various images of the chunks of rock and ice orbiting our Sun, sometimes including their signature tails.
